title: Annita McVeigh, Ben Brown and Geeta Guru-Murthy appointed as chief presenters for BBC News Channel
description: Annita McVeigh, Ben Brown and Geeta Guru-Murthy will take up chief presenting roles on the BBC’s news channel – BBC News – which is broadcast in the UK and around the world.

title: BBC Strictly Come Dancing's Nikita Kuzmin brutally booed by audience during live show
description: Strictly Come Dancing pro Nikita Kuzmin was booed by the audience during the show's live tour, after a secret was spilled by fellow dancer Kai Widdrington

title: 'The Repercussions Affect Us The Most': Youngsters Say What They Really Think About Brexit
description: Those who were unable to vote when the Brexit referendum was held in 2016, now aged 19 to 21 years old, revealed to International Business Times UK how the independence scheme has changed their lives.

title: Stormont: Assembly to sit on Saturday as DUP boycott ends
description: The Northern Ireland Assembly is to sit on Saturday after the Democratic Unionist Party (DUP) ended its boycott of the power-sharing institutions. The DUP leader Sir Jeffrey Donaldson wrote to the Speaker following the passage of legislation in the House of Commons on Thursday.

title: Latest Northern Ireland-wide public transport strike causes 'considerable disruption' laments business chief
description: Another Northern Ireland-wide public transport strike has caused “considerable disruption” to commerce, and further planned action should be frozen in light of political progress, a business chief has said.

title: Why Holocaust film The Zone of Interest is a warning to us all
description: The Zone of Interest, which has been nominated for five Academy Awards including Best Picture, follows a family living in a house next door to Auschwitz. Directed by British filmmaker Jonathan Glazer, who is also nominated for Best Director, it stars German actor Christian Friedel as Auschwitz commandant Rudolf Hoss.

title: Christopher Steele: Orbis welcomes High Court victory over Trump
description: A British consultancy that compiled a salacious dossier linking Donald Trump to Russia has welcomed a UK High Court decision to throw out a lawsuit by the former US president. Orbis Business Intelligence - run by ex-MI6 officer Christopher Steele - said it was "delighted" by the ruling.

title: Public transport strike
description: Another Northern Ireland-wide public transport strike has caused “considerable disruption” to commerce, and further planned action should be frozen in light of political progress, a business chief has said.

title: Starmer to press ahead with Labour plans to ‘level-up workers’ rights’
description: Rachel Reeves has refused to give a commitment to lift income tax thresholds. The shadow chancellor said the tax burden is the “highest it has been in 70 years” but it would be “damaging” to promise tax cuts without knowing how they would be paid for.

title: Ex-PM Boris Johnson Attacks Rishi Sunak's New Brexit Deal
description: ex-PM Boris Johnson has attacked Rishi Sunak's new Brexit deal with the DUP, warning that it could force the UK to abide by EU trade rules in the future. This week, Sunak revealed new arrangements to remove routine checks on goods moving from Great Britain ...

title: Former Rochdale MP Simon Danczuk is standing in a by-election for his old seat
description: Former Rochdale MP Simon Danczuk has announced he is seeking to reclaim his old seat in Parliament. The ex-Labour MP will represent Reform UK - the party founded by former UKIP leader Nigel Farage - at the Rochdale by-election later this month.

title: Irish Sea border remains after Stormont deal, claims loyalist Jamie Bryson
description: The move comes after the DUP agreed a package of measures with the UK Government that party leader Sir Jeffrey Donaldson says has effectively removed the trading border for goods moving from Great Britain to, and staying in, Northern Ireland.

title: Cambourne residents walk to Cambridge to fundraise for Gaza charity
description: A group of Cambourne residents walked into Cambridge at the weekend as a fundraiser for a charity caring for Gazan residents caught up in the turmoil in Palestine. The walk, which went along St Neots Road, through Madingley and into the centre of Cambridge, joined up with a pro-Palestine march taking place in the city on Saturday afternoon.

title: Flat-faced dogs ‘have 40% higher risk of shorter lives than other breeds’
description: Flat-faced dogs such as pugs and French bulldogs have a 40% increased risk of living shorter lives than other breeds, researchers have said. New study suggests the average life expectancy of all dogs in the UK is around 12.5 years, with the Lancashire heeler expected to live the longest at 15.4 years.

title: Reform UK unveil ex-Labour MP as their candidate in Rochdale by-election
description: Reform UK has pulled off a shock coup after announcing their candidate for the upcoming Rochdale by-election will be none other than the constituency’s former Labour MP. description: Sir Lindsey Hoyle said Commons authorities “never stop looking ahead to see what else we can do to protect MPs” and insisted Parliament would “never give in to terrorism” or threats.
